action.action-desc: Mr. Hatch, from the Committee on Finance, reported the following original bill; which was read twice and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the types of wines taxed as hard cider.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Cider Investment and Development through Excise Tax Reduction (CIDER) Act.

section.header: Modification of definition of hard cider

subsection.text: Section 5041 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
For purposes of subsection (b)(6), the term hard cider means a wine—

paragraph.text: containing not more than 0.64 gram of carbon dioxide per hundred milliliters of wine, except that the Secretary may by regulations prescribe such tolerances to this limitation as may be reasonably necessary in good commercial practice,

subparagraph.text: apples, apple juice concentrate, pears, or pear juice concentrate, and

paragraph.text: which contains no fruit product or fruit flavoring other than apple or pear, and
which contains at least one-half of 1 percent and less than 8.5 percent alcohol by volume.

subsection.text: Paragraph (6) of section 5041(b) of such Code is amended by striking which is a still wine and all that follows through alcohol by volume.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to articles removed during calendar years beginning after December 31, 2015.
Paragraph (3) of section 6331(h) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 30 percent and inserting 35 percent.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to payments made after 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
